Homework 7a

Programming Language BSL

Due Date Tues at 9:00pm (Week 7)

Purpose Explore Lambda

Exercises

Take Me To Church

Alonzo Church is one of the founders of computer science: he came up with the λ calculus, which we know and love so dearly. In fact, he famously argued that λ, much like love, is all you need! Let’s see whether or not he was right by investigating one of our favorite atomic data types, booleans.

; A Bool is a [X X -> X]

Exercise 1 Define the two shortest functions that have this signature. The functions are restricted to only use λ expressions and variables. These will be our Bools.

Exercise 2 Design a bool->boolean function, which will allow us to test the functions we define below by converting to normal ISL #true / #false.

For the following three functions, besides define and λ, your function definitions should not use any ISL-provided functions or keywords (and certainly not bool->boolean, #true or #false).

Exercise 3 Design and/bool, which functions analogusly to and, but takes in two Bools and outputs a Bool.

Exercise 4 Design or/bool, which functions analogusly to or, but takes in two Bools and outputs a Bool.

Exercise 5 Design not/bool, which functions analogusly to not, but takes in one Bool and outputs a Bool.
